code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:78 yr old white m presents with moderate thigh pain, moderate difficulty climbing stairs, moderate difficulty walking and Heart for 10 days. denies any alcohol use Patient does not smoke o:Height 74 in, Weight 127 lbs, Temperature 99 F, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 175, DiastolicBP 108, Respiration 16, 2D echocardiogram panel shows left Ventricular Hypertrophy, ECG LVH, Heart = 3/6 systolic murmur over the right second intercostal space, S1 and S2 present, Skin = shiny appearance, dry, erythematous skin at lower extremities, Chest = clear to auscultation B/L, no rales or wheezing, Extremities = absent dorsalis pulsation's B/L a:Hypertension p:administered metoprolol - 50 mg daily, performed 2D echocardiogram panel, ECG, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

td.content: s:a white male retired aged 79 ys presents with moderate difficulty walking x 5 weeks. pt also complains of moderate difficulty climbing stairs, moderate thigh pain. o:Height 75 in, Weight 128 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 179, DiastolicBP 109, Respiration 16, 2D echocardiogram panel shows left Ventricular Hypertrophy, ECG LVH, Heart = 3/6 systolic murmur over the right second intercostal space, S1 and S2 present, Skin = shiny appearance, dry, erythematous skin at lower extremities, Chest = clear to auscultation B/L, no rales or wheezing, Extremities = absent dorsalis pulsation's B/L a:Hypertension p:administered metoprolol - 50 mg daily, performed 2D echocardiogram panel, ECG, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
